data.question: What are the names of the two coordination polymers discussed?
What is the synthesis temperature for Ga1 and In1?
Is the emission spectrum of Ga1 centered at 413 nm?
What is the pH range required for the synthesis of Ga1 and In1?
Do Ga1 and In1 exhibit tunable fluorescence?
What changes the emission color of Ga1 and In1?
Are Ga1 and In1 isomorphous?
What is the coordination geometry around every Ga3+ cation in Ga1?
Does the emission spectrum of In1 at 298 K have shoulder-peaks?
What is the effect of solvent polarity on the PL of Ga1 and In1 at 77 K?
data.answer: It extends the PL to the white region

data.question: Are the lifetimes of Ga1 and In1 longer at 77 K compared to 298 K?
What is the role of deuterated solvents in the luminescence of Ga1 and In1?
data.answer: They tend to give light from blue, green to yellow region at 77 K

data.question: Is the thermal stability of In1 better than Ga1?
What is the main challenge in synthesizing Ga(III)/In(III)-based coordination polymers?
data.answer: The hydrolysis of Group 13 metal(III) salt

data.question: Do Ga1 and In1 have potential applications in luminescent materials?
What is the pitch of the handed helices in Ga1?
What is the effect of increasing solution polarity on the emission of In1 at 298 K?
data.answer: It reduces the relative intensity of the HE peak but enhances the LE band

data.question: Are the bond lengths in Ga1 longer than those observed in most other Ga(III) coordination polymers?
What is the effect of temperature on the tunable fluorescence of Ga1 and In1?
data.answer: The fluorescence changes from blue, green, white to yellow light

data.question: What is the coordination mode of 1,4-bda ligands in Ga1?
